pullRequest.body:
Also use it instead of `dcomp` or an inline lambda here and there.

---

### PR summary [384475696c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17482/commits/384475696cd5ac813c683060798d28e6e1ee6a28)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Bijective.piMap`
`+ Injective.piMap`
`+ Surjective.piMap`
`+ map`
`+ map_apply`
`+ piMap`
`+ piMap_image_pi`
`+ piMap_image_univ_pi`
`+ range_piMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

In some cases `dcomp` is used for reindexing of a dependent function. But https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=Function.dcomp returns only 5 results, one of them is the definition and two others I'm overriding in this PR (I added them in #15694), so we may want to drop `dcomp` completely (deprecate, unfold notation in 2 lemmas, delete in N months).

:facepalm: I should think twice before writing, of course `dcomp` is still more general. So everything is good.

bors r+

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11244297057/job/31262040889)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11244297057/job/31262041143)
I like this change a lot, but it leaves a question: what is the use for `dcomp` now? Is the point just to have another reducibility setting? Should we deprecate `dcomp` as well?
I like this change a lot, but it leaves a question: what is the use for `dcomp` now? Is the point just to have another reducibility setting? Should we deprecate `dcomp` as well?

Flagging this for other reviewers: you changed the statement of the lemma, renamed it and are adding an alias.
I think this is more helpful than harmful, but seems worth pointing out.
No, I think it's just the GitHub view that is confusing.
I changed the statement from `dcomp` to `Pi.map`. They are defeq but not reducibly defeq.
Oh yeah ok I just misinterpreted that comment I think.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Logic/Function): define `Pi.map`

nodes.body:
### PR summary [384475696c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17482/commits/384475696cd5ac813c683060798d28e6e1ee6a28)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Bijective.piMap`
`+ Injective.piMap`
`+ Surjective.piMap`
`+ map`
`+ map_apply`
`+ piMap`
`+ piMap_image_pi`
`+ piMap_image_univ_pi`
`+ range_piMap`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I like this change a lot, but it leaves a question: what is the use for `dcomp` now? Is the point just to have another reducibility setting? Should we deprecate `dcomp` as well?

In some cases `dcomp` is used for reindexing of a dependent function. But https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=Function.dcomp returns only 5 results, one of them is the definition and two others I'm overriding in this PR (I added them in #15694), so we may want to drop `dcomp` completely (deprecate, unfold notation in 2 lemmas, delete in N months).

:facepalm: I should think twice before writing, of course `dcomp` is still more general. So everything is good.

bors r+

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11244297057/job/31262040889)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11244297057/job/31262041143)
